info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:32PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN BAILEY...COCHRAN...WESTERN HOCKLEY AND SOUTHWESTERN LAMB COUNTIES... At 432 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Maple to 3 miles northwest of Lehman to 11 miles north of Bronco, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Levelland, Morton, Sundown, Bledsoe, Bula, Enochs, Pep, Lehman, Maple, Whiteface, and Opdyke West. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
